Description: Blue glazed composition plaque: a foundation deposit of Ramses IV (?). The prenomen and nomen of a Ramses are incised on one side of this plaque, while the other side bears an incised decoration, perhaps of part of a temple. The blue glazed composition is much faded. The incised signs are inlaid with black glaze.
Curator's comments: Bibliography. E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), 214 (no. 49); K.A. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' 7 (Oxford: Blackwell Press), 326.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1993 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 12. (Pl.14-15)
Acquisition notes: This piece was acquired in Luxor and may have come from one of the temples of Ramesses IV in that area.
